website_summaries.verdict: A highly reliable and inexpensive pump that packs a punch with its durable construction and 3-in-1 compatible nozzle.
pros: Despite the low price, this aluminum alloy bike pump has decent volume and solid construction
Customers have very few issues with it, noting its comfortable design and smooth pumping motion
The ability to use it as a floor/hand is convenient, and the 3-in-1 nozzle works well for a variety of tasks beyond inflating bike tires
cons: The pressure gauge is difficult to read and not always reliable, but the handful of other features make up for this shortcoming

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and pump
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to pump up my bike tires. It comes with different valve's and it comes with a little carry bag for all of it so you dont loose any pieces.
customer_reviews.author: JO184

customer_reviews.title: Pump
customer_reviews.text: Comes with connectors to pump up sports balls and bicycle tires
customer_reviews.author: stanley B

customer_reviews.title: compact bike pump
customer_reviews.text: use bike pump for bicycle tires & sports equipment, compact & can carry everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: rover

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME TOOL
customer_reviews.text: It literally does it all, even pumping air shocks forks.
customer_reviews.author: José T.

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I liked that it is just the right size for the jobs I need it to do! I am extremely happy with this purchase Because I can carry with me or place on my bike or in my car to take to the park to air our balls up . Soccer football basketball
customer_reviews.author: Sofie Perez

customer_reviews.title: Yes it is for presta valves
customer_reviews.text: A couple reviewers said this does not work for presta valves. It does - you just have to figure out how to use it. The silver barrel at the end of the inflation hose unscrews from its black-colored base. You then extend the barrel. Now you can screw the barrel onto a presta valve threads. Bottom line is you can inflate either Schrader valves or presta valves with no additional attachments. The adapter is built into the hose.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M Andrus

customer_reviews.title: This is a piece of crap...
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this if you want to use it on a presta valve. The instructions are worthless. I tried it on two tires and the attachment pulled out the stems in the inner tube, rendering them flat and useless. Now I have to go to a bike store to find a real portable bike pump as this garbage I purchased does nothing except ruin good inner tubes. I'd giver this product zero stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: christopher c wessel

customer_reviews.title: Good and not so good
customer_reviews.text: 1. it is compact. 2. The pressure gauge is too hard to read. It is (as stated in the paperwork) accurate to 8 psi. Since my tires take 45-70 psi, it is possible to overinflate, while intending to pump the tires to 65 psi. I ended up using a separate pressure gauge for checking the pressure. 3. Takes a lot of pumping, 200+ times to get my 700cX45 tire to 60 psi.
customer_reviews.author: E. Gokan

customer_reviews.title: Let me down when I needed it
customer_reviews.text: I just got back from a ride where my front tire went flat. I carry a spare tube so I switched it out and got out my visnfa pump that I've only had for a few months and had previously used a couple times just for practice. This was my first actual roadside use of it... and it got the tire about 60% inflated before practically crumbling in my hands. Thankfully, I was able to get home. And now I'm on Amazon looking for some other brand of pump to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Stetka

customer_reviews.title: Comes apart during use which then cuts your hands!
customer_reviews.text: Same problem as other users; when using with schrader valves, unscrews the valve and leaves tire flat, and comes apart while using which then cuts your hands all up. Both hands are all cut up now. Pump is unsafe to use. The top part (black) threads into top of pump, but comes unscrewed and then results in the top part coming in contact with your hands which is sharp and then becomes a skin skinning device.
customer_reviews.author: MCB31904

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: The pump came apart on me three times airing up two tires. It got real hot at bottom of pump wear the hose Connected. Would not go over 30 psi and while pumping Gauge kept dropping to 20 psi.
customer_reviews.author: MOON

customer_reviews.title: Defective design
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these, both of them broke on the 1st use in the same place. The pressure gauge is defective in its design, the plastic cylinder breaks at one end near a gasket with the slightest force. Do not carry this thinking it will save you in the event of a flat tire.
customer_reviews.author: Velocty30

customer_reviews.title: Decent pump
customer_reviews.text: This pump is very efficient at getting you tires up to pressure. I do not mount it on my bike, I keep it at home. It could mount on my bike, it has the hardware to do so but it would be a bit bigger than most bike pumps. What I like about this pump is the threaded connection to either a presta or shreader valve. I am tired of pumps with the rubber compression fitting, they start to become difficult to remove and cause air losses. Also, this pump seems more efficient at getting air into the tire, not sure if that is true but it sure feels like it.
customer_reviews.author: Ciaran

customer_reviews.title: Its ok but it siezed
customer_reviews.text: After a handful of uses the pump has siezed and will not compress. I have yet to take it apart but beyond that the pressure gauge should be tightened up before use and its prone to sticking so keep that in mind when reading it. The hose could certainly be a little longer for ease of use or perhaps they could 86 the cheap guage and replace that with a full length hose for added flexibility. Aesthetically its great and it worked wonderfully while it did work.
customer_reviews.author: Callmedaddy

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: I received this 1.5 months ago and have only used it a few times, as I don't ride my bike that often. I liked the low profile and I wanted something that showed the pressure. The last time I used it, filled my front tire just fine, then when I attached it to the rear tire, a little rubber gasket ring popped out and proceeded to drain my tire of air. My tire wasn't even that low, but it completely drained it before I could remove it. I really wanted to like this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jana H.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't get how to use this pump and attach safely to my bike
customer_reviews.text: I actually returned this product as I think it would have been a safety hazard if I were to strap it to my bike. There is a little lever that flips out so you can stand on it to stabilize the pump while you pump your tire. I couldn't see how you could properly secure this lever to ensure it doesn't flip out an possibly jam into the pedal or chain while riding. Maybe I just didn't understand it.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart and cut my hand, twice!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pump in June and have only used it twice. Both times it fell apart while pumping my tire. Both times it cut my hand. It didn't even fill my tire with air. Worse pump I have ever used. Even the cheaper ones never cut my damn hand!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bre

customer_reviews.title: EASILY BREAKS AND DOESN'T PUMP ANY AIR
customer_reviews.text: This is garbage. It fell apart as I tried to pump my presta valve bike and no air pumped! I felt air brush on my legs. DO NOT BUY. The instructions might as well have been written in Chinese, you couldn't tell what was what and it the pictures did not match the actual parts AT ALL. This product ruined my excitement to finally go on my new bike.
customer_reviews.author: ivette reyes

customer_reviews.title: A compact air pump that works well.
customer_reviews.text: The air pump appears to be well made and comes with bicycle mounting hardware. The pressure gauge is designed for higher pressure items like bicycle tires. I needed the air pump for a reverse osmosis tank which only requires 5 to 7 psi. So with a digital pressure gauge this air pump worked well for me.
customer_reviews.author: R.T. Reiman

customer_reviews.title: Pump
customer_reviews.text: I bought this air pump so that I could bring it when I go outdoors. This pump is useful to have as compared to the other pumps because of it’s flexible hose. It makes it easier to keep the needle from breaking when I pump sport balls. It was smooth and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Peter T.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Just got it out of the box and tried it out....its great! more compact than I expected and pumps better too. easily got my tires to the pressure I needed without breaking a sweat. Not great instructions but you can figure it out
customer_reviews.author: kristen dixon

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product just incase I ever had to repair a flat, just strapped it to the bike and expected it to work when needed, that day came and I went to use the pump, it doesn't work unsure if the cylinder is jammed or what. Maybe I got a faulty one, I'd say definitely check it before assuming. 40 dollar ride back and the cost of this, I am out almost 80 dollars. I am outside of the return window. I have a similar larger pump, and I had no issues once i got back home with the other pump. If you buy this product make sure it works!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It worked twice and that’s about it
customer_reviews.text: This pump failed me on the third use. The pressure gauge plastic has a hairline crack that leaks air and renders this expensive pump absolutely useless. I don’t have a lot of strength in my hands so I’m not sure what caused the crack. I guess it’s just a fragile piece of plastic that separates it from working and being a piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: Maya E.

customer_reviews.title: Waist of money
customer_reviews.text: First ride I took it on the tube for the gauge cracked and the pump is useless. Don’t wast your time or money on this.
customer_reviews.author: A person

customer_reviews.title: It's worth every dime!
customer_reviews.text: Had my 1st flat on the road 15 miles from home. If I didn't just put this on my bike 2 days ago, well, I'd still be walking home 8 hours later. Great product. I bought this based on a video I saw: The 5 Best Bike Pumps. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Slayke

customer_reviews.title: Pressure gauge on the pump does not function
customer_reviews.text: The pressure gauge on this pump dosent work. I reached out to Visnfa through Amazon ( the only way I found I could. They seem to not have a company email....) with the product number and they told me the pointer on the gauge would point to the correct pressure as I pumped. The gauge is in a tube. If it worked, the indicator line would go up and down. They don't even know what form the guage is in even though I gave them the specific product number.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte L. Crittenden

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easily pumps up to pressure. gauge is hard to see way down there on the ground. Needs something to keep it from slipping in the frame bracket.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Lilyea

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy little pump. It takes a while to pump a tire as this is not a strong pump. The gauge works okay but not terribly impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Thatsmekb

customer_reviews.title: Use with caution
customer_reviews.text: Pump seemed to work great then the bottom piece, inside pump, broke and skinned me. Even push rod bent. So I guess if you pump with caution it will pump your tire.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice
customer_reviews.text: Gauge can not be used. I guess it’s broken. Could not pump enough air into my road bike’s tire.
customer_reviews.author: ORM

customer_reviews.title: Compact. Efficient mini floor pump.
customer_reviews.text: Use this on a tour across Nevada. Had several flats over the 500 miles and had no issues inflating all the tubes/tires 700x28-35. Was able to get the pressures up to 80psi with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Trash Ninja

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Pump stopped working after first use. I successfully used the pump to help another rider w/ a flat; it never worked again, handle would lock in the up position, if/when you could push it down no air comes out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: Hard to read and gauge starts at 20 psi so doesn't help if you want lower psi.
customer_reviews.author: lisa mallard

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I would not use this pump for anything other than skinny road bike tires or footballs. I purchased this to use on fat tire bikes and the volume of air that it delivers just won't cut it. Was working up a good sweat before I finally gave up and broke out the electric compressor. Build quality, well I paid $20 bucks so I will not complain.
customer_reviews.author: pwood

customer_reviews.title: Not dependable
customer_reviews.text: I liked the size and ease of mounting, however after one use that went fine, on second use the tube to the pump burst at the connector and rendered unusable. So for one use was good....after that useless
customer_reviews.author: vic

customer_reviews.title: Bike pump - pumps air
customer_reviews.text: Quality construction- gauge tricky to read - took a minute to figure out presto application - broke after 5 uses .
customer_reviews.author: Lexi C

customer_reviews.title: Pump it up
customer_reviews.text: Compact and ever useful. I keep mine in my bike pouch, but you can mount it if needed. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Wuzthere

customer_reviews.title: Looks great breaks at first use. Fast response by Visnfa
customer_reviews.text: The pump looks great. It seems well built. The first time I used it to fix a flat on the bicycle the T handle broke off. I managed to partially inflate the tire to get home. Vinsfa replaced the pump in short order. Very good customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Molly M. Hamel

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy and hard to use
customer_reviews.text: This is not going to last, pumping with it is torture, it will take forever and should be used only a last resort on-the-road plan b.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of the built in gauge but it doesn't work well.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Galvez ESpinoza

customer_reviews.title: Broke apart first use.
customer_reviews.text: it broke apart on first use. Hose length too short.
customer_reviews.author: 1oddmanout

customer_reviews.title: Breaks presta tubes
customer_reviews.text: This pump does not work for Presta tubes. The valves get pulled out of the stem when you go to disconnect the pump and you’re left with a flat tube. It also came apart while pumping by the gauge and by the top of the cylinder so I had to repeatedly put it back together during my futile attempt to pump my tire. It may work fine for Schrader, but I went through 3 good tubes trying to get this to work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very compact
customer_reviews.text: This pump is very compact and light weight. The psi gauge only jumps up at random times so it can be a little difficult to get the correct measurement. Otherwise great pump to be on the go
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work. The small size isn't worth the hassle at all. :(
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer D Ong

customer_reviews.title: The sharader valve thread is weak
customer_reviews.text: The thread for the shrader vavle is too weak it already stripped
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Gauge broke on the first use
customer_reviews.text: Gauge broke after the first use. Pump still works but I was looking for the one with pump and gauge together. Too bad the gauge no longer works. I used this after the return period, so I cannot return it either.
customer_reviews.author: Jea Choi

customer_reviews.title: Will no last. Inflated 2 tires before it broke.
customer_reviews.text: Broke on second tire inflated. Internal check valve no longer works. Leaks air continuously.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin kunk

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy!
customer_reviews.text: This product broke on the second tire I tried to pump up. It is horrible. Do not buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Small enough to carry
customer_reviews.text: My bike has the flat time for a few times, this is small one and come in handy
customer_reviews.author: Chen

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy: too cheap. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: !!!!This product is horrible. Zero stars. The valve does not let air into the tire at all. I tightened all I could tighten and made sure everything was put together correctly. I used it literally twice. Horrible, do not buy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Weak adhesive for pump gauge.
customer_reviews.text: Pump gauge popped open, rendering the pump completely useless after only the third application. Item was kept strictly indoors, used once on each tire then not again until the next cycling season.
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: do not buy this product
customer_reviews.text: I Just used it for one time and Stop working
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pump!
customer_reviews.text: This bike pump is small and fits on the bike perfectly. Which is very convenient since I have to deal with goat heads putting hole in my tires.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: Returned it thought it was just a defect then the second still not working! Awkward to use, not “user friendly”
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Jerome Sindac

customer_reviews.title: Will fall apart at the plastic threads, easy to thread back if not fully stripped.
customer_reviews.text: Hold down the plastic threaded stop that's at the shaft transition. Pump faster than the small constant leak on the system.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Piepmeier

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for emergencies and it failed miserably. DID NOT work on Schrader valves. As I was desperately trying to pump up my tire the whole unit starting falling apart. Poorly made and a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: lililalulu

customer_reviews.title: Compact pump.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Wanted a small, portable pump for road repairs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Neat
customer_reviews.text: Could be more snug to the bike but I have a very small bike.
customer_reviews.author: Maureem Weincouff

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, but pumping shaft broke the first time I used it. Fixed it with some tape and it still works.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan SantaOlalla

customer_reviews.title: Not for Presta Bicycle Tire Valves
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to the person before me who said the same thing. Alas. The pump damaged my Presta tire valve and I had to replace the tire because of it. Not good!
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pump
customer_reviews.text: Ideal pump for my mountain bile. Mounted very easy.. Excellent pump w/ gauge
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ernst

product_meta.title: visnfa Portable Mini Bike Pump with Pressure Gauge and High Pressure 160 PSI - Aluminum Alloy Mini Bicycle Pump Fits Presta & Schrader Valve and No Adapter Needed (Cold gray)
feature_bullets: ★ [Compatible All Valves] Innovatively designed new mini portable bike tire pump that is compatible with 2 valves(Presta Schrader valve). When inflating tires of different types of valves, no adapter needed. It can be converted directly. So easy and save your time!!

★ [High Pressure, Labor Saving] The maximum pressure is 160 PSI / 11 bar with a Pressure Gauge. Most situation this pump can also use as a shock pump and inflate rear suspension and fork suspension. With its unique design, it is more labor-saving than traditional portable pumps, even if you inflate high-pressure tires effortlessly!

★ [High-Quality Aluminum Alloy] The air Pump is made of 6063 aluminum alloy and has anodized surface, which not only has a beautiful appearance, but also has better corrosion resistance. The hose is made of a special high temperature rubber hose, so it is not easy to break and damage!

★ [Lightweight, Portable] This bicycle tire pump has a height of about 283mm (11 inches) and weighs about 213g(7.5 oz). It is equipped with a stand that can be used to attach the pump to the Bike Frame-Mount or to store the pump in the backpack using the included storage bag!
★ [Perfect After-sales Service] If you have any questions, please contact us by email, our after-sales service team will serve you wholeheartedly!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars200 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
